content: The Act is titled the "National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2015." References to the National Sea Grant College Program Act are modified, and the Dean John A. Knauuss Marine Policy Fellowship is also amended. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2015 modifies Section 208(b) to prioritize placements of fellows in Congress. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2015 prioritizes placing fellows in Congress based on jurisdiction and political party distribution, effective the first calendar year after enactment. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2015 prioritizes placing fellows in Congress based on jurisdiction and political party distribution. Congress encourages Federal agencies to consider hiring fellowship awardees for workforce positions at the conclusion of their fellowship. Modification of authority for Secretary of Commerce to accept donations for National Sea Grant College Program. The Secretary of Commerce can now accept donations of money and voluntary services for the National Sea Grant College Program. Priorities for donation use will be established, including potentially placing more fellows in legislative offices. A report is required within 180 days. The Director of the National Sea Grant College Program, in consultation with advisory boards, must develop recommendations for donation use and submit a report to Congress within 180 days. This section does not limit other funding available for marine policy fellowships. The Director of the National Sea Grant College Program must develop recommendations for donation use and submit a report to Congress within 180 days. Funding may be appropriated under section 212 of the Act. The requirement for a report on the coordination of oceans and coastal research activities is repealed. The frequency for the National Sea Grant Advisory Board report is reduced to once every 3 years. Elements of the National Sea Grant College Program are modified. SEC. 7 amends Section 204(b) of the National Sea Grant College Program to include various purposes for financial assistance. SEC. 8 authorizes appropriations for the program. In General, Section 212(a) (33 U.S.C. 1131(a)) is amended to specify funding amounts for fiscal years 2015 to 2021. Section 212(a) (33 U.S.C. 1131(a)) is amended to specify funding amounts for fiscal years 2015 to 2021, including $6,000,000 for each fiscal year 2015 through 2020 for competitive grants for university research on aquatic nonnative species, oyster diseases, harmful algal blooms, and related areas. University research, education, training, and extension services focused on coastal resilience, U.S. working waterfronts, aquaculture techniques, and fishery extension activities are key priorities identified in the strategic plan. Amendments are made to the limitations on amounts for administration of programs under this title. Amendments are made to the limitations on amounts for administration of programs under this title, including critical staffing requirements to meet any staffing needs. Amendments are made to the allocation of funding for sea grant colleges, institutes, programs, and projects under Section 204(d)(3) (33 U.S.C. 1123(d)(3)). Amendments include reallocating funding among sea grant colleges, institutes, programs, and projects by repealing certain distribution requirements. SEC. 9. TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS. The National Sea Grant College Program Act is amended to adjust certain clauses and sentences for clarity and accuracy.
